intro: Leptospermum flavescens f. grandiflorum, commonly known as the golden tea tree, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional herbal remedies.
